feed.title: LF-Air
feed.subtitle: RSS feed based on RSS and LLM.

entry.title: Vite report on Mon, 21 Aug 2023 04:00:57
entry.summary:
Tech:
- Run a macOS VM on Apple Silicon from a double-click with Vimy
- SwitchBot says its new smart curtain controller is stronger and quieter
- Demystifying EKS Authentication and Authorization: A Guide to Strengthening Network Security
- Comprehensive Walkthrough on How to Connect Your Flutter App to a REST API
- Researchers from Cornell Introduce Quantization with Incoherence Processing (QuIP): A New AI Method based on the Insight that Quantization Benefits from Incoherent Weight and Hessian Matrices
- Get your own WebRTC Audio and Video using Open Source, Self Hosted Coturn for your Turn Server!

Business:
- A fellow Yale secret society member said Ron DeSantis rolled his eyes when she talked about her upbringing as a Hispanic girl in Texas: 'It was like I wasn't worth listening to'
- A Marylander who hadn't recently traveled internationally caught malaria. Officials say it's the state's first 'locally acquired' case in 40 years.
- I was a USPS letter carrier for 44 years. To protect us from extreme heat, the postal service needs to provide more training and air-conditioned trucks.
- On 1-Year Anniversary Of Inflation Reduction Act’s Signing, Impact On Drug Prices And Out-Of-Pocket Spending Still To Be Determined
- The owner of a 1,900-square-foot house next to the Masters golf course kept turning down millions of dollars to sell
- GOP presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy says he can bring in 'voters of diverse shades of melanin' to the party by focusing on the economy
- A Maui restaurant owner is 'praying visitors will start to come back soon'
- Mexico replaced China as America's top trade buddy — and it shows how the global economy is rapidly transforming

AI:
- What happens to Salma Hayek in 'Black Mirror' might seem ridiculous – but the way celebrities handle their AI rights could affect us all
- Researchers from Cornell Introduce Quantization with Incoherence Processing (QuIP): A New AI Method based on the Insight that Quantization Benefits from Incoherent Weight and Hessian Matrices
- ‘Baldur’s Gate 3’ Has Some Of The Best Romances In Gaming History, If Not The Best

Other:
- Pompeii find reveals the secrets of life as a slave in Ancient Rome, frozen in time for almost 2,000 years by volcanic eruption
- Data centres account for between 1.5% and 2% of global electricity consumption
- Adobe co-founder Dr. John Warnock has died — he was 82
- Tesla's massive data breach in May affected more than 75,000 people, carmaker says
- Ukraine lacks the drone capacity to strike enough targets in Russia to erode its 'will to fight,' retired US colonel says
- The Pentagon’s UFO Shop, the Hitchhiker Effect, and Models of Contagion [pdf]
- Ancient viruses could re-emerge as permafrost melts, posing 'unpredictable threats' to our communities, new study says
- X glitch wipes out most pictures and links tweeted before December 2014
- Video captures the terrifying moment a Russian ballistic missile slammed into a theatre in the Ukrainian city of Chernihiv killing 7, wounding 144

Insights:
- The tech section highlights advancements in macOS VM, smart curtain controllers, network security, app development, and AI methods.
- The business section covers topics such as discrimination, public health, postal service, drug prices, real estate, politics, and tourism.
- The AI section explores the intersection of AI and celebrity rights, as well as its application in gaming.
- The other section includes historical discoveries, energy consumption, obituary, data breach, military capabilities, UFOs, permafrost risks, social media glitch, and international conflicts.
- Overall, the report showcases a diverse range of topics, highlighting technological advancements, societal issues, historical findings, and global events.
